data.chText: 小心；注意；谨慎
data.enText: giving attention or thought to what you are doing so that you avoid hurting yourself, damaging sth or doing sth wrong

data.chText: 小心！
data.enText: Be careful!

data.chText: 他小心翼翼地躲开别人的视线。
data.enText: He was careful to keep out of sight.

data.chText: 注意别吵醒了宝宝。
data.enText: Be careful not to wake the baby.

data.chText: 接触化学药品必须小心谨慎。
data.enText: You must be careful when handling chemicals.

data.chText: 注意交通安全。
data.enText: Be careful of the traffic.

data.chText: 请当心别打碎我的眼镜。
data.enText: Please be careful with my glasses (= Don't break them) .

data.chText: 留神别撞了头。
data.enText: Be careful you don't bump your head.

data.chText: 细致的；精心的；慎重的
data.enText: giving a lot of attention to details

data.chText: 精雕细琢的作品
data.enText: a careful piece of work

data.chText: 对事实的仔细调查
data.enText: a careful examination of the facts

data.chText: 经过慎重考虑后，我们决定给你这份工作。
data.enText: After careful consideration we have decided to offer you the job.

data.chText: 请仔细地听。
data.enText: Please listen carefully.

data.chText: 她小心翼翼地放下玻璃杯。
data.enText: She put the glass down carefully.

data.chText: 小心开车。
data.enText: Drive carefully.
you can't be too careful

data.chText: 无论怎样小心也不会过分；越小心越好
data.enText: used to warn sb that they should take care to avoid danger or problems

data.chText: 别在太阳底下待得太久，你得尽量小心。
data.enText: Don't stay out in the sun for too long─you can't be too careful.
careful with money

data.chText: 花钱精打细算；不乱花钱
data.enText: not spending money on unimportant things

data.chText: cautious指人因担心某事危险或不明智而缓慢行事或小心谨慎。（反义词为rash）
data.enText: A cautious person is nervous that something may be dangerous or unwise, so they only do it very slowly or after a lot of thought. (opposite = rash )

data.chText: careful指人并非担心害怕，但为确保万无一失而做事小心仔细。（反义词为careless）
data.enText: A careful person is not nervous but does take extra care to make sure that everything is correct or nothing goes wrong. (opposite = careless )

data.chText: 还要注意：
data.enText: Notice also

data.chText: 在冰霜覆盖的道路上驾驶时要小心。
data.enText: Be careful / Take care when you drive on icy roads.

data.chText: 小心 / 警告——有薄冰。
data.enText: Caution / Warning ─ thin ice.

simple_means.memory_skill: care 关心 + ful 有…的 → 小心的

ex.chText: 作最后决定之前问问你父母的意见兴许更稳妥。
ex.enText: It might be prudent to get your parents' opinions before you make the final decision.

ex.chText: 我的建议是你应该和谨慎的购房者聊聊。
ex.enText: My suggestion is that you should talk with the prudent house buyers.

synonyms.bx: 指明智而谨慎的，尤指避免不必要的风险，不贸然行事。

ex.chText: 他是她见过的最谨慎的司机。
ex.enText: He is the most careful driver she has ever met.

ex.chText: 服务生拿汤的时候很小心，怕把汤泼出来。
ex.enText: The waiter was being very careful with the soap so as not to spill it.

synonyms.bx: 指非常小心的，力求避免做错事或造成损失。

ex.chText: 与会各方都对这项通告表示谨慎乐观。
ex.enText: All sides have expressed cautious optimism about the announcement.

ex.chText: 该政府采取了谨慎的态度处理危机。
ex.enText: The government has taken a cautious approach to the crisis.

synonyms.bx: 既可指人谨慎细心的，也可指态度、批评方式等经过仔细考虑的，目的在于避开危险或风险。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：谨慎的，小心的

ex.zh: 极其仔细（或慎重、节约）的
非常仔细（或慎重、节约）的

data.enText: you can't be too careful

data.chText: 无论怎样小心也不会过分；越小心越好
data.enText: used to warn sb that they should take care to avoid danger or problems

data.chText: 别在太阳底下待得太久，你得尽量小心。
data.enText: Don't stay out in the sun for too long─you can't be too careful.
careful with money

data.chText: 花钱精打细算；不乱花钱
data.enText: not spending money on unimportant things

tr: exercising caution or showing care or attention
example: they were careful when crossing the busy street
be careful to keep her shoes clean
careful of the rights of others

tr: unhurried and with care and dignity
example: walking at the same measured pace

tr: mindful of the future in spending money

example: Thou art careful and troubled about many things"-Luke 10.4

value.def: If you are careful, you give serious attention to what you are doing, in order to avoid harm, damage, or mistakes. If you are careful to do something, you make sure that you do it.

example.ex: Be very careful with this stuff, it can be dangerous if it isn't handled properly...
example.tran: 这东西一定要小心,稍不注意的话就会有危险。

example.ex: We had to be very careful not to be seen...
example.tran: 我们得小心翼翼,不能被发现。

example.ex: Pupils will need careful guidance on their choice of options.
example.tran: 小学生在作出选择时需要悉心指导。

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link ADJ, oft ADJ <l>about/with/of</l> n, ADJ to-inf

example.ex: Have a nice time, dear, and drive carefully...
example.tran: 好好玩,亲爱的,开车小心点。

example.ex: He had chosen his words carefully in declaring that the murderers were madmen.
example.tran: 他在宣布这些杀人犯精神错乱时,措词很谨慎。

value.def: Careful work, thought, or examination is thorough and shows a concern for details.

example.ex: He has decided to prosecute her after careful consideration of all the relevant facts...
example.tran: 在认真考虑了所有相关事实后,他决定起诉她。

example.ex: What we now know about the disease was learned by careful study of diseased organs.
example.tran: 我们目前对该疾病的认识是通过对病变器官的仔细研究得来的。

example.ex: ...a vast series of deliberate and carefully planned thefts...
example.tran: 多起蓄谋已久、精心策划的盗窃案

example.ex: He explained very carefully what he was doing.
example.tran: 他非常详细地解释了自己手头正在做的事。

value.def: If you tell someone to be careful about doing something, you think that what they intend to do is probably wrong, and that they should think seriously before they do it.

example.ex: I think you should be careful about talking of the rebels as heroes...
example.tran: 我觉得你说话应该小心,不能把反叛分子当英雄。

example.ex: It is important, I think, for everyone to be careful about claiming victory.
example.tran: 我想,每个人宣布胜利时都应该慎重。

example.ex: He should think carefully about actions like this which play into the hands of his opponents.
example.tran: 他在采取这种正中对手下怀的行动前应该仔细考虑。

value.def: If you are careful with something such as money or resources, you use or spend only what is necessary.

example.ex: You will have to make a special effort to train your child to be careful with her pocket-money...
example.tran: 你得格外注意培养孩子的节俭意识，零花钱要省着花。

example.ex: It would force industries to be more careful with natural resources.
example.tran: 这将迫使企业更加节约资源。

value.def: You can say 'You can't be too careful' as a way of advising someone to be careful, even when this seems unnecessary.

example.ex: You can't be too careful when a young child is near water.
example.tran: 孩子在水边时,还是越小心越好。

value.tran: 越谨慎越好;再小心也不为过

meanings.td: 表形容词，“有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的”

partsOfSpeech.dec: care 关心 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 小心的
doubt 怀疑 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 可疑的
forget 忘记 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 易忘的
hope 希望 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 有希望的
peace 和平 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 和平的
rue 悔恨 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 后悔的
shame 耻辱 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 可耻的
tact 手腕；老练 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 圆滑的
will 意志 + ful 有…的，具有…性质的，易于…的 → 任意 → 任性的
arm 手臂 + ful 充满时的量 → 一抱
boat 小船 + ful 充满时的量 → 一船
dish 盘 + ful 充满时的量 → 一碟
hand 手 + ful 充满时的量 → 一把
mouth 口 + ful 充满时的量 → 一口
spoon 匙 + ful 充满时的量 → 一勺
